      • getOptions

        public @NonNull java.util.List<java.lang.String> getOptions()

        getOptions in interface CommandLineOptionHandler
        Returns:
        the options of this option handler. For example: "help" for a help command

      • getProcessPriority

        public double getProcessPriority()
        Description copied from interface: CommandLineOptionHandler
        Returns the processing priority of this option handler. Option handlers with a lower priority double are handled first. There are no limits to the double, it's just that the option handlers are sorted according to their processing priority.
        Specified by:
        getProcessPriority in interface CommandLineOptionHandler
        Returns:
        the processing priority

      • getArgumentCount

        public int getArgumentCount()
        Description copied from interface: CommandLineOptionHandler
        Returns the amount of arguments this option handler accepts. This becomes relevant when CommandLineOptionHandler.allowMultiple() returns true.
        Specified by:
        getArgumentCount in interface CommandLineOptionHandler
        Returns:
        the amount of arguments

      • allowMultiple

        public boolean allowMultiple()
        Specified by:
        allowMultiple in interface CommandLineOptionHandler
        Returns:
        whether the option can be passed multiple times

      • setParserSettings

        public joptsimple.OptionSpec<?> setParserSettings(@NonNull joptsimple.OptionParser optionParser)
        Description copied from interface: CommandLineOptionHandler
        Sets the settings for the JOpt Simple parser. This sets settings like which options are part of this option handler (according to getOptions()), whether arguments are required and how they are described in the help message.
        Specified by:
        setParserSettings in interface CommandLineOptionHandler
        Parameters:
        optionParser - the OptionParser of JOpt Simple
        Returns:
        the option specification of this option handler
        See Also:
        JOpt Simple: OptionParser

      • validate

        public void validate(@NonNull GreenMirrorController controller,
                     java.lang.String... parameters)
              throws CommandLineOptionHandler.FatalException
        Description copied from interface: CommandLineOptionHandler
        Validates the passed arguments. It throws a FatalException if the arguments couldn't be validated. It might need the GreenMirror controller to validate the arguments.
        Specified by:
        validate in interface CommandLineOptionHandler
        Parameters:
        controller - the GreenMirror controller
        parameters - the arguments of this option
        Throws:
        CommandLineOptionHandler.FatalException - if the arguments can't be validated

        Description copied from interface: CommandLineOptionHandler

        Specified by:

        Throws:
